Effects Library

We have a number of guitar effects pedals available to borrow.

The library is a ‘low admin’ enterprise and runs on goodwill and trust.

We do our best to make sure everything is working for you, and can advise you about how to use it, including the correct way to power them.

This service is run voluntarily by Dave Johnson at Bingley Guitar Studio, First Floor 122-124 Main Street (above Ison Harrison Solicitors), Bingley, BD16 2HL

Instruments

We also take in and re-home instruments that people no longer need. See our instruments page to find out more.

Request an effect

Fill in our Request an Instrument form, and we’ll be in touch.

Donate an instrument

If you have unused gear that you’d like to donate to the library, please fill in our Donate an Instrument form , and we’ll be in touch.

Effects

Switch

SoundLab SAB10 AB Switch

Allows you to have two instruments that go to the same output so you can switch between them, or, turn it round and have one instrument and select between outputs.

Chorus

Daphon E10CH Super Chorus

Don't be fooled by the looks this is a great little chorus pedal. Clone of the Ibanez Soundtank CS5 Super Chorus. Check out the review on JHS Pedals

Daphon E10CH Super Chorus

Chorus

Daphon E20CH Super Chorus

This is a slightly moremodern version of the Daphon E10CH. Again really an Ibanez clone. Sounds great.

Daphon E20CH Super Chorus

Compressor

Arion SC0-1

Cheap but good pedals from many years ago. This one is missing the battery cover. This an 'ACA' type pedal, so check you're using the correct power supply.

Compressor

Omnifex 720C

A good compressor - hard to find much information about it. Two knobs, nice and simple.

Distortion

Danelectro FAB

Great sounding distortion in a very cheap package. Watch the JHS video about the FAB line of pedals for more.

Danelectro FAB

Distortion

Digitech Grunge

Probably not really the sound of Nirvana, but fun distortion pedal nether the less. The link takes you to the DOD version of it.

Digitech Grunge

Distortion

Profile+ Metal MTL-5

Not just for metal, but a pedal capable of alot of distortion.

EQ

Behringer EQ 700

An EQ pedal is a versatile workhorse caple of doing lots of things. If you want to experiment, here's your chance.

Behringer EQ 700

Fuzz

Behringer Super Fuzz SF300

Great, versatile little fuzz pedal. As good (and often better than) many of the more expensive pedals out there. Google it.

Behringer Super Fuzz SF300

Fuzz

Vachon Audio Fiuzz
On loan until 01/12/2023

A hand built fuzz, made a workshop with pedal builder Dave Vachon. A great fuzz, needs a 9V battery.

Octave

Beta Alvin Super Octaver OC-100

An Octave pedal that has been repaired. The octave works, but the fuzz part of it does not.

Overdrive

Danelectro FAB

Great sounding overdrive in a very cheap package. Watch the JHS video about the FAB line of pedals for more.

Overdrive

Maxx OD-10 Super Over Drive

Clearly a BOSS copy. Sounds great.

Overdrive

Star Sound OD-6

I'm going to say this is a Tubescreamer clone of the Soundtank TS5. Watch the video for an idea.

Star Sound OD-6

Overdrive

Wholenote OD-6

I'm going to say this is a Tubescreamer clone of the Soundtank TS5. Watch the video for an idea.

Wholenote OD-6

Phaser

Wholenote PH-7

I'm going to say this is another Soundtank clone. I think it's a 4 stage phaser, so good for classic phaser sounds.

Sustain Pedal

Roland Sustain Pedal

A non-latching switch that can act as a sustain pedal for midi-keyboards, but may also be useful with other effects.

Tremollo

Marshall Vibratrem VT-1

Vibrato? Tremolo? Both? Best effect ever?

Marshall Vibratrem VT-1

Tuner

Korg DT-10

Slightly battered tuner. Does the job.

Korg DT-10

Wah

Dunlop Cry Baby GCB-95

The Cry Baby Wah is the most iconic guitar effect in music history - according to the people who want to sell them to you.

Dunlop Cry Baby GCB-95

Wah

Morley M2 Maverick

A traditional-sounding switchless wah pedal. To activate this pedal, all you need to do is put your foot onto the treadle; once you release your foot, the pedal will go back into bypass mode. The pedal’s 100-kOhm potentiometer helps influence the wah’s classic tone, travel, and Q.

Morley M2 Maverick

Wah

Morley Pro Series Wah

Pretty sure this works as both a volume pedal and a wah. Optical operation. The video link is not the exact model.

Morley Pro Series Wah

Get involved

Why not become a member and get involved to make a difference?

Sign up to our mailing list to stay informed about what’s happening.

If you have an idea for music in our town, or you’re already doing something, then we’d love to hear it.
Please contact us and tell us all about it.

Can you help? See our Help Wanted page for more opportunities to get involved.
